channel.title: [317] Need Help! Review this people pls
channel.description:
k well i pretty much got my whole server like done just few glitched i need to fix. but i need help with one thing only. not portforwarding because i heard wireless network no need to portforward but to host my server. here's what i've done so far.
1.Opened router ports
2.Downloaded no-ip.
3.Created a no-ip.biz hostname click on it put it online etc
4. Created Port 43594 on my firewall and put exception.
5. I run my server and get error...
And well i tried with utorrent i did exactly what the tutorial said for utorrent and i got this error
[code][2009-09-23 07:57:52] TCP port bind failed 0.0.0.0:43594: (10048) Only one usage of each socket address (protocol/network address/port) is normally permitted. [/code]
I'd like help pls any replies to help me out or some suggestions. im tired of hamachi it fails major..

@Scape-JAVA wrote:

Ipconfig works only on a Windows Xp

Don’t listen to this Pea brain

run it as an administrator.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Need Help! Review this people pls
item.dc:creator: @loved loved
item.description:
@loved wrote:

ipconfig say that on mine as well, but how to work it is, either instead of going run>cmd>ipconfig go run>ipconfig and it should come up, if not find your wireless router by getting the name, for example mine is linksys WRT160N and search the defualt ip adress on the internet and you will find it.

Read full topic
item.source: [317] Need Help! Review this people pls

item.title: [317] Need Help! Review this people pls
item.dc:creator: @Asante213 Asante213
item.description:
@Asante213 wrote:

Thats not true.

From a command prompt type “path” - without the quotes. If ‘windows\system32’ doesn’t show, you can add it to the ‘path’ statement by right clicking on My Computer, selecting Properties and then the Advanced tab. Next, click on the ‘Environment Variables…’ button. After that highlight the path statement in the lower box and then click the ‘Edit’ button. Add ‘;%systemroot%\system32’ - without the quotes - to the end of the path statement. You will then have to reboot your PC for the addition to take effect.

That should fix it if you need your ip in a hurry then…
http://ipchicken.com/

Read full topic

Ipconfig works only on a Windows Xp

item.dc:creator: @Skillapwnz Skillapwnz
item.description:
@Skillapwnz wrote:

trust me i did everything possible pretty much im just like pissed that i probably messed up somewhere but idk where. and i would like if someone would make a hosting server guide in depth so i can understand cause really i have trouble understanding things over the computer. and like my firewall is off. if anyone has teamview and email pls help me on teamviewer if anyone can thx. cuz i gotta like not really good but not bad at coding and all i need is too host and i’ve wanted to be able to host a server for more then 2 years now.

but you already created put a firewall on port 43594 with exceptions , just take down ur firewall, and portfoward by going to your internet connection administration screen .
